title: Resume
text:
MS in Epidemiology @ Columbia University (CUIMC)
New York, NY · zx2528@cumc.columbia.edu · (+1) 646-309-4668



Columbia University · Master of Science in Epidemiology (in progress)
New York, NY · Aug 2024 – expected May 2026


Core: Principles of Epidemiology, Intro to Biostatistical Methods, Data Science, Graphical Models for Complex Health Data, Spatial Epidemiology, Emerging Infectious Epidemiology

Muskingum University · B.A. in Public Health
New Concord, OH · Aug 2020 – May 2024


Dean’s List (2023–2024).
Core: Biomedical Ethics, Health Policy, Nutrition Across the Lifespan, Epidemiology, Social Gerontology, Health Disparities, Global Health





Huaibei Occupational Disease Prevention Hospital — Data Analyst & Audiometry Technician
Huaibei, China · Jun 2023 – Aug 2023
- Processed and analyzed occupational health exam data for miners; identified key factors associated with pneumoconiosis.
- Performed audiometric testing for miners and Intco Medical employees; analyzed noise-induced hearing loss patterns, highlighting roles of job type, exposure duration, age, and high-frequency thresholds.
Huaibei Adverse Drug Reaction Monitoring Center — Data Analyst Intern
Huaibei, China · Dec 2022 – Mar 2023
- Categorized ADR reports, queried historical cases, and produced analysis to support data-driven decision making.
- Led data entry/analysis for ADR cases and delivered public education on drug safety.




Brain Network Analysis of Autism Spectrum Disorder using Structure Learning Methods
Columbia University · Dec 2024
- Applied PC and GES algorithms to fMRI data (27 subjects) to compare ASD vs. neurotypical connectivity.
- Summarized networks via edge counts, path lengths, clustering coefficients; differences were consistently non-significant across α-levels.
- Discussed PC’s stability and GES limitations in high-dimensional settings; emphasized sample size needs.
Socioeconomic Factors & COVID-19 Vaccination Effectiveness in China
Muskingum University · May 2024
- Analyzed provincial vaccination patterns; highlighted rural–urban disparities (e.g., access gaps, travel distance, infrastructure).
- Found higher education linked with greater hesitancy; offered evidence-based recommendations for targeted promotion strategies.




Coursera (selected):
- Programming for Everybody (Python); Capstone: Retrieving, Processing & Visualizing Data with Python
- Mathematics for Machine Learning: Linear Algebra, Multivariate Calculus




COVID-19 Pandemic Prevention & Control — Huaibei, China
Jul–Aug 2022; Nov–Dec 2022
- Supported nucleic-acid testing, mask checks, and travel-code verification.
- Assisted clinical staff with sample collection and accurate data logging.





Email: zx2528@cumc.columbia.edu

GitHub: github.com/ZizhiXia

Location: New York, NY
